Question: In January 1981, WWWW switched to a country music format much to the chagrin of this person, who left the station soon after.
Hints: Impressed with his ratings success, NBC approached this person with an offer to work afternoons at WNBC in New York City.
This person wished to pursue a radio career at the age of five.
On September 30, 1985, this person and Quivers were fired for what management termed "conceptual differences" regarding the show.
